column4: can anyone give a few pointers on fixing wired connection problems? My wired connection dies after a few hours, I've tried restarting eth0 to no avail
isn't you wifi card? Its Rtl for any reason ?
well it could be my ethernet card, im using wired, how do i check? thanks
lspci may give you some clue
i'ved tried ifconfig eth0 down..up, and sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart which didn't do anything
only after a reboot you connection come back?
only after reboot
so its almost certainly that is a driver/card problem... you could avoid rebooting unloading and reloading you wifi card module from kernel
how do I reload my ethernet card module? thanks
first you have to know which is you card module, pastebin you lspci output and lsmod output please
ok just a sec, I need to restart the comp, thanks
ok
lspci: pastebin.com/MaLTdkGi  lsmod: pastebin.com/t11yz9Di    Thanks!
if I'm not wrong, and someone correct me if I'm, you broadcom module is b43, so rmmod b43 && modprobe b43 could be a good try before rebooting
great, thanks for the help. So to totally resolve this problem, I would have to find a driver patch? its odd since I'ved used the same config for about a year, and it only happened recently.
I never trusted broadcom drivers, but to me, using ndiswrapper with the windows driver always worked better, you should give a try
So the problem is with my wired interface, the broadcom card is for wireless, would it be a different module for my wired card? Thanks

oh sorry, I thought the problem was with your wifi... well, you wired uses a realtek driver, which isn't so good too, but you can't use ndiswrapper for wired connection, so unloading the module and reloading it I think its you best try before trying to find a better driver
I think your rtl driver is 8139too
what do you mean its 8139 too? Do I reload the same b43 module? Thanks
if the problem is with the wired connection so try unloading and reloading the module "rmmod 8139too && modprobe 8139too"
ah ok got it!
that is not the first time I see problem with those cards...
yea, its a crappy card, figures
